rubric.name: factual_accuracy
rubric.description: All claims cite verifiable internal or public sources. No hallucinations or outdated stats.
check: Every number, quote, or policy call-out links to a source.
Dates reference the most recent approved publication (<=12 months).

rubric.name: tone_alignment
rubric.description: Reads like a patient coach for non-technical professionals; avoids jargon and blame.
check: Explains acronyms on first use and replaces engineering slang with plain language.
Recognizes user skepticism and acknowledges prior frustrations before proposing solutions.

rubric.name: clarity
rubric.description: Structured to scan quickly with headings, bullets, and direct CTAs.
check: Uses short paragraphs (<80 words) and front-loads key actions.
Includes summaries for any table, chart, or attachment.

rubric.name: actionability
rubric.description: Provides exact steps, owners, and timing for the recommended action.
check: Specifies who needs to do what, by when, and with which tool or template.

rubric.name: risk
rubric.description: Flags potential compliance, privacy, or expectation issues before delivery.
check: Identifies data sensitivity (public/internal/confidential) and required approvals.
Documents review status from Legal, Security, or CRA as needed.

scoring_notes: Multiply each category score by its weight, sum, and compare to overall_pass. Anything below threshold returns to author with CRA feedback JSON.
